context_evidences: - Twitter unlocked the president’s @realDonaldTrump Twitter account, which has 88 million followers, after Trump removed three rule-breaking tweets. His first post back on the platform featured a video in which he said he was focused on a peaceful transition of power and which was viewed 1.4 million times within 15 minutes of posting. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/article/uk-usa-election-facebook-idUKKBN29C29M published on 2021-01-07 16:25:57

- Tech companies have been scrambling to crack down on the president’s baseless claims about the Nov. 3 U.S. presidential election after hundreds of Trump supporters stormed the U.S. Capitol in unrest that resulted in four deaths. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/article/uk-usa-election-facebook-idUKKBN29C29M published on 2021-01-07 16:25:57
correction_response: This tweet is potentially misleading. Twitter, like any other online platform, may experience technical issues, but there's no credible source indicating an imminent risk of "breaking". Always verify such claims from official sources.
note_1_text: Currently, Twitter has not experienced outages. At this point, speculation is driving the rumors that Twitter will "break".     https://thenewdaily.com.au/life/tech/2022/11/18/twitter-shutdown-elon-musk/
note_2_text: Currently, there is no evidence backing up this claim.
